title: Watch: Fraser Minten scores game-sealing goal for Bruins against his former team
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Fraser Minten scored a late insurance goal for the Boston Bruins in a 5-3 win over the Maple Leafs.
Minten, traded from Toronto last season, marked his third goal of the year against his former team.
Bruins' head coach Marco Sturm praised Minten as 'the best player on the ice' after the victory.

title: Bruins legend Zdeno Chara describes ‘surreal’ induction into Hockey Hall of Fame
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Zdeno Chara was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame in Toronto during weekend ceremonies.
Chara and Joe Thornton, both honored in the 2025 class, celebrated their inductions together.
Chara, a Stanley Cup champion, was a seven-time All-Star and won the 2008-09 Norris Trophy.

title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox are active in free agency, with $25 million budget room below first luxury tax threshold.
Insiders predict Red Sox could re-sign Alex Bregman; mixed opinions on Kyle Schwarber, Pete Alonso signings.
Red Sox mentioned as potential suitors for Munetaka Murakami, Dylan Cease, and Framber Valdez in offseason moves.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway on November 7, 2025, showcasing his debut album 'Get Lifted'.
The concert included songs from 'Get Lifted' and covers by artists like The Beatles, Lauryn Hill, and Alicia Keys.
Legend's performance highlighted his musical versatility with an array of R&B, gospel, and soulful renditions.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating after Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Magic, hinting at bias in the fourth quarter.
Brown previously expressed dissatisfaction with refs after Celtics' 105-103 loss to the Jazz, citing a missed foul call.
Despite criticizing officiating, Brown was not fined for comments after the Jazz game, where an error was confirmed by the league.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers hold a 6-2 record, with losses to NFC leaders, Eagles and Lions.
Baker Mayfield is a deep pass threat, completing 14 of 39 long throws for 511 yards and 8 touchdowns.
Despite injuries to key players like Mike Evans and Chris Godwin, Buccaneers' defense ranks seventh in DVOA.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo will call the Patriots-Buccaneers on CBS, their first Patriots game since 2023.
The Patriots' renewed relevance is highlighted by CBS's top team calling their game, previously covered by lower-tier announcers.
Jim Nantz looks forward to broadcasting and meeting Patriots QB Drake Maye, with whom he shares a personal connection.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Orlando Magic defeated the Boston Celtics 123-110, handing them their first loss in the NBA Cup.
Jaylen Brown scored 32 points on 15-for-28 shooting but struggled from three-point range, going 1-for-6.
Magic’s Franz Wagner scored 27 points, and Desmond Bane contributed 22 points, six rebounds, and seven assists.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph to receive public reprimand for creating appearance of impropriety in 2018 ICE-related incident.
Massachusetts Commission on Judicial Conduct report finds Joseph unaware of immigrant's escape plan, no evidence of misconduct.
Federal charges against Joseph were dropped in 2022, previously suspended for allegedly helping immigrant evade ICE arrest.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: The Red Sox were eliminated by the Yankees in the American League Wild Card Series, winning just one game.
Shortstop Trevor Story opted into his contract, while third baseman Alex Bregman chose to opt out.
Manager Alex Cora expresses optimism for the team's future despite roster uncertainties ahead of the 2026 season.
